item.title: Air traffic controllers promised fast shutdown pay, but they've been told that before
item.description: The Transportation Secretary says air traffic controllers will be paid promptly as the government reopens. But after the last shutdown, in 2019, some controllers sued to get paid in full for overtime.

item.title: A decade after the Bataclan attacks, France is still grappling with how to remember
item.description: In the 2015 attacks, 130 people were killed, including at the Bataclan concert hall. France is still wrestling with how to remember the deadliest attack on its soil in modern history and how to live with it.

item.title: 'We need to get out of here': Trump's immigration crackdown is quietly reshaping where immigrants live in America
item.description: The Trump administration says that more than 1.6 million immigrants have self-deported. But there's also evidence of an internal migration from target cities and states and into quieter areas that feel safer.
